channel.title: Question :/
channel.description:
I have some questions (although it might seem nooby to some of you)
1) how do I open a .java or .cfg file? 2) how do I save changes to a .java or .cfg file? 3) could i mess up my computer by openning these files and changing them?

item.title: Question :/
item.dc:creator: @Odimaru Odimaru
item.description:
@Odimaru wrote:

No problem!

~^!^~Odimaru~^!^~

Read full topic

@Tanaku2005 wrote:

ok thank u

Read full topic

item.title: Question :/
item.dc:creator: @Odimaru Odimaru
item.description:
@Odimaru wrote:

  1. A for a .java file, right click the file & click “Open With…” and select notepad. For a .cfg file, right click it, click “Open With…” and select wordpad.
  2. At the top of the notepad/wordpad, click File > Save as… > Save.
  3. It doesn’t change anything except what you edit. It won’t harm your computer what-so-ever as long as you don’t save it to a WINDOWS file or something…

Good luck with it!

~^!^~Odimaru~^!^~

Read full topic

item.title: Question :/
item.dc:creator: @Tanaku2005 Tanaku2005
item.description:
@Tanaku2005 wrote:

ok, better way to ask question one:

  1. when i try to open a .java or .cfg file a pop up appears saying:

You are attemption to open a file of type “Microsoft Office Outlook Configuration File” (.cfg)

These files are used by the operating system and by various programs. Editing or modifying them could damage your system.

If you still want to open the file, click Open With, otherwise, click Cancel.

what do i do?? (plz, in detailed steps)

Read full topic
